definition: to lean against or on/to stand by the side of/to come near to/to depend on/to trust/to fuck (vulgar)/traditional military costume drama where the performers wear armor (old)
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable

lit. the mountain dweller lives off the mountain, the shore dweller lives off the sea (idiom)/fig. to make the best use of local resources/to exploit one's position to advance oneself/to find one's niche/to live off the land
pinyin: kao4 shan1 chi1 shan1 , kao4 shui3 chi1 shui3

sentences.english: I hope that you will become our patron.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你将成为我们的靠山。

sentences.english: The good abbot of holy wood is a strong pillar to the weak.
sentences.chinese: “圣林”修道院是弱者强有力的靠山。

sentences.english: Patron or no patron, what care I? You DO care.
sentences.chinese: 有没有靠山，难道我会在乎么？

sentences.english: Sam knows he can depend on his family, rainorshine.
sentences.chinese: 山木知道不论境遇如何，他都可把家庭作为靠山。

sentences.english: Each stack of sheets is combined with a backer sheet of chipboard or heavy paper.
sentences.chinese: 每个表的堆栈是结合靠山表的硬纸板或重磅纸。

sentences.english: Both religious and non-religious blacks depended on the church.
sentences.chinese: 无论信教还是不信教的黑人，都把教堂当作靠山。

sentences.english: You are welcome to stay in one of our exquisite villas.
sentences.chinese: 本疗养院靠山傍水，幢幢精美的别墅待君光临。

sentences.english: The good Abbot of Holywood is a strong pillar to the weak.
sentences.chinese: “圣林”修道院的主持是弱者的万无一失的靠山。

sentences.english: When he was 24 he painted a portrait of Philip IV, who became his patron.
sentences.chinese: 当他24他画的肖像弘四，谁成了他的靠山。

definition: to overthrow/downfall/to fall from power/to go bankrupt
asylum/shelter/to shield/to put under protection/to take under one's wing
lit. to hide the sky with one hand/to hide the truth from the masses
to rely on help from sb
domain/territory under one's control/foundation of a building/base of operations/crust of earth
